channel.title: Wildy prob
channel.description: hey i have a small problem. i originally i made a pk game (where you could attack players anywhere apart from the shops and training areas, but now i don't want it because it wrecks the game! i need to know how to restrict this to only being able to attack players in the wilderess and my pk arenas. how do i do this?

item.title: Wildy prob
item.dc:creator: @java-programmer java-programmer
item.description:
@java-programmer wrote:

thanks will do =D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 04, 2008, 12:45:32 PM[/size][hr]it says this

} public boolean nonWild() { if((absX >=3259 && absX <=3273 && absY >=3407 && absY <=3425 ) || (absX >=2509 && absX <=2544 && absY >=4762 && absY <=4794 ) || (absX >=3144 && absX <=3188 && absY >=9730 && absY <=9751) || (absX >=3145 && absX <=3181 && absY >=9765 && absY <=9785) || (absX >=3141 && absX <=3157 && absY >=9736 && absY <=9765) || (absX >=3162 && absX <=3176 && absY >=9735 && absY <=9751) || (absX >=3181 && absX <=3193 && absY >=9751 && absY <=9782) || (absX >=3353 && absX <=3373 && absY >=3295 && absY <=3324) || heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

so which co-ords do i change?

Read full topic

item.title: Wildy prob
item.dc:creator: @inuyasha_12345 inuyasha 12345
item.description:
@inuyasha_12345 wrote:

search for nonwild or inwild in your client.java, i think its nonwild for all safe apart from listed coords and vise versa, just edit those coords for the places u choose (test to see what happens first to see which one you got)

Read full topic

item.title: Wildy prob
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

delta:

How can you make a pk game if you dont even know nonWild?

Haha i lol’d…

[quote=“java-programmer, post:3, topic:170789”][quote author=delta link=topic=230765.msg1976011#msg1976011 date=1199487654]
How can you make a pk game if you dont even know nonWild?
[/quote]

what u mean?? lol[/quote]

You didn’t make it so you can attack anyone apart from shops, if you don’t know how to use the nonWild boolean…
